result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Briggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit to be paid as a condition of probation.
Court costs waived.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia without valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency and provide verification to Agent that they were notified.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: First 90 days straight time.  Remainder of sentence NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence July 22, 2015 by 12:00 p.m.  If defendant has no violations after 6 months he is to be transferred to Day Report Center for the remainder of the sentence.  Condition time may be served in Milwaukee County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

(4) character letters

Defendant Robert E Briggs in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statements by defendant.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- Buy money of $450.00 to be paid to Metro Drug Unit as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency and provide verification to Agent that they were notified.  
CONDITION TIME: 1 year - First 90 days straight time.  Remainder of sentence NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence July 22, 2015 by 12:00 pm.  If defendant has no violations after 6 months he is to be transferred to Day Report Center for the remainder of the sentence.  Condition time may be served in Milwaukee County.
